1.name: Dracula
1.description: The centuries old vampire Count Dracula comes to England to seduce his barrister Jonathan Harker's fiancée Mina Murray and inflict havoc in the foreign land.

2.name: Così fan tutte
2.description: A happily married 24-year-old woman who experiences an inexplicable, rather restless craving to finally live her life intensely, retells her extra-marital escapades to her husband intending to spice up their marriage.

3.name: Reservoir Dogs
3.description: When a simple jewelry heist goes horribly wrong, the surviving criminals begin to suspect that one of them is a police informant.

4.name: Aladdin
4.description: A kindhearted street urchin and a power-hungry Grand Vizier vie for a magic lamp that has the power to make their deepest wishes come true.

5.name: Candyman
5.description: The Candyman, a murderous soul with a hook for a hand, is accidentally summoned to reality by a skeptic grad student researching the monster's myth.

6.name: Unforgiven
6.description: Retired Old West gunslinger William Munny (Clint Eastwood) reluctantly takes on one last job, with the help of his old partner Ned Logan (Morgan Freeman) and a young man, The "Schofield Kid" (Jaimz Woolvett).

7.name: Batman Returns
7.description: Batman returns to the big screen when a deformed man calling himself the Penguin wreaks havoc across Gotham with the help of a cruel businessman.

8.name: The Mighty Ducks
8.description: A self-centered Minnesota lawyer is sentenced to community service coaching a rag tag youth hockey team.

9.name: Basic Instinct
9.description: A violent police detective investigates a brutal murder, in which a manipulative and seductive novelist could be involved.

10.name: Scent of a Woman
10.description: A prep school student needing money agrees to "babysit" a blind man, but the job is not at all what he anticipated.

11.name: My Cousin Vinny
11.description: Two New Yorkers are accused of murder in rural Alabama while on their way back to college, and one of their cousins--an inexperienced, loudmouth lawyer not accustomed to Southern rules and manners--comes in to defend them.

12.name: A League of Their Own
12.description: Two sisters join the first female professional baseball league and struggle to help it succeed amidst their own growing rivalry.

13.name: Army of Darkness
13.description: A man is accidentally transported to 1300 A.D., where he must battle an army of the dead and retrieve the Necronomicon so he can return home.

14.name: A Few Good Men
14.description: Military lawyer Lieutenant Daniel Kaffee defends Marines accused of murder. They contend they were acting under orders.

15.name: Wayne's World
15.description: Two slacker friends try to promote their public-access cable show.

16.name: The Last of the Mohicans
16.description: Three trappers protect the daughters of a British Colonel in the midst of the French and Indian War.

17.name: Home Alone 2: Lost in New York
17.description: One year after Kevin McCallister was left home alone and had to defeat a pair of bumbling burglars, he accidentally finds himself stranded in New York City - and the same criminals are not far behind.

18.name: Alien³
18.description: After her last encounter, Ellen Ripley crash-lands on Fiorina 161, a maximum security prison. When a series of strange and deadly events occur shortly after her arrival, Ripley realizes that she has brought along an unwelcome visitor.

19.name: Death Becomes Her
19.description: When a woman learns of an immortality treatment, she sees it as a way to outdo her long-time rival.

20.name: The Bodyguard
20.description: A former Secret Service agent takes on the job of bodyguard to an R&B singer, whose lifestyle is most unlike a President's.

21.name: Universal Soldier
21.description: Private Luc Deveraux and his sadistic sergeant, Andrew Scott, got killed in Viet Nam. The army uses their bodies for a secret project - reanimating dead soldiers as deadly obedient cyborgs. However, their memories come back too.

22.name: Sleepwalkers
22.description: A mother-and-son team of strange supernatural creatures move to a small town to seek out a young virgin to feed on.

23.name: Beethoven
23.description: A slobbering St. Bernard becomes the center of attention for a loving family, but must contend with a dog-napping veterinarian and his henchmen.

24.name: FernGully: The Last Rainforest
24.description: The magical inhabitants of a rainforest fight to save their home, which is threatened by logging and a polluting force of destruction called Hexxus.

25.name: Hoffa
25.description: The story of the notorious American labor union figure Jimmy Hoffa, who organizes a bitter strike, makes deals with members of the organized crime syndicate and mysteriously disappears in 1975.

26.name: A River Runs Through It
26.description: The story about two sons of a stern minister -- one reserved, one rebellious -- growing up in rural Montana while devoted to fly fishing.

27.name: Patriot Games
27.description: When CIA analyst Jack Ryan interferes with an IRA assassination, a renegade faction targets him and his family for revenge.

28.name: Bitter Moon
28.description: After hearing stories of her, a passenger on a cruise ship develops an irresistible infatuation with an eccentric paraplegic's wife.

29.name: Twin Peaks: Fire Walk with Me
29.description: A young FBI agent disappears while investigating a murder miles from Twin Peaks that may be related to the future murder of Laura Palmer; the last week of the life of Laura Palmer is chronicled.

30.name: Glengarry Glen Ross
30.description: An examination of the machinations behind the scenes at a real estate office.

31.name: Buffy the Vampire Slayer
31.description: A flighty teenage girl learns that she is her generation's destined battler of vampires.

32.name: Braindead
32.description: A young man's mother is bitten by a Sumatran rat-monkey. She gets sick and dies, at which time she comes back to life, killing and eating dogs, nurses, friends, and neighbors.

33.name: Bad Lieutenant
33.description: While investigating a young nun's rape, a corrupt New York City police detective, with a serious drug and gambling addiction, tries to change his ways and find forgiveness and redemption.

34.name: Poison Ivy
34.description: A seductive teen befriends an introverted high school student and schemes her way into the lives of her wealthy family.

35.name: The Crying Game
35.description: A British soldier kidnapped by IRA terrorists soon befriends one of his captors, who then becomes drawn into the soldier's world.

36.name: Cool World
36.description: A comic strip femme fatale seeks to seduce her cartoonist creator in order to cross over into the real world.

37.name: Under Siege
37.description: An ex-Navy Seal turned cook is the only person who can stop a group of terrorists when they seize control of a U.S. battleship.

38.name: Hellraiser III: Hell on Earth
38.description: An investigative reporter must send the newly unbound Pinhead and his legions back to Hell.

39.name: Sister Act
39.description: When a worldly singer witnesses a mob crime, the police hide her as a nun in a traditional convent where she has trouble fitting in.

40.name: Lethal Weapon 3
40.description: Martin Riggs and Roger Murtaugh pursue a former LAPD officer who uses his knowledge of police procedure and policies to steal and sell confiscated guns and ammunition to local street gangs.

41.name: Newsies
41.description: A musical based on the New York City newsboy strike of 1899. When young newspaper sellers are exploited beyond reason by their bosses they set out to enact change and are met by the ruthlessness of big business.

42.name: Of Mice and Men
42.description: Two drifters, one a gentle but slow giant, try to make money working the fields during the Depression so they can fulfill their dreams.

43.name: Far and Away
43.description: A young Irish couple flee to the States, but subsequently struggle to obtain land and prosper freely.

44.name: Malcolm X
44.description: Biographical epic of the controversial and influential Black Nationalist leader, from his early life and career as a small-time gangster, to his ministry as a member of the Nation of Islam.

45.name: White Men Can't Jump
45.description: Black and white basketball hustlers join forces to double their chances of winning money on the street courts and in a basketball tournament.

46.name: American Me
46.description: A Mexican-American Mafia kingpin is released from prison, falls in love for the first time, and grows introspective about his gangster lifestyle.

47.name: Chaplin
47.description: A movie about the troubled and controversial life of the master comedy filmmaker Charlie Chaplin.

48.name: Single White Female
48.description: A woman advertising for a new roommate finds that something very strange is going on with the tenant who decides to move in.

49.name: The Lawnmower Man
49.description: A simple man is turned into a genius through the application of computer science.

50.name: Encino Man
50.description: When they find a frozen caveman in their back yard, two high school outcasts thaw him and introduce him to modern life while he in turn gets them to actually enjoy life.
